title: Travelling Well: The ‘Must Have’ Guide to a Safe and Healthy Journey
abstract:
Peter A. Leggat MD, PhD, DrPH, FAFPHM, FACTM, FFTM ACTM, FFTM RCPSG, Professor and Head, Tropical Medicine and Rehabilitation Sciences School of Public Health , James Cook University, Townsville, Queensland 4811 , Australia. 

14th Ed, 192 pp, paperback with illustrations, AUS$24.95, ISBN 978–0–9577179–7–8, Brisbane, Australia: Dr Deborah Mills, 2007.

The World Tourism Organization estimated that there were a record 900 million international tourist arrivals in 2007.1 It is known that about 50% of travelers encounter some kind of health and safety problem while they are traveling.2 Travel health advisers are confronted with a formidable task in educating and advising travelers about potential hazards and need to provide written material to travelers to help reinforce this advice. The availability today of a number of travel health reference publications specifically catering for travelers has assisted greatly. The 14th edition of Travelling Well is one such reference and one that has established itself as one of the leading educational aids in Australasia for travelers going abroad.

Travelling Well is presented as a 192‐page A5 publication with an attractive, full‐color, glossy travelogue cover. Travelling Well promotes itself well in the opening sections. It also contains acknowledgments, a contents page, a foreword by Major General John Pearn, a section called “How to Use This Book,” an introduction, five sections, a drug reference table insert, 41 subsections, 11 tables, five more formal figures, six disease distribution maps, copious other illustrations, a comprehensive index, and …
